1    | /*****
2    |  ** ** Module Header ******************************************************* **
3    |  ** 									     **
4    |  **   Modules Revision 3.0						     **
5    |  **   Providing a flexible user environment				     **
6    |  ** 									     **
7    |  **   File:		cmdPath.c					     **
8    |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
9    |  ** 									     **
10   |  **   Authors:	John Furlan, jlf@behere.com				     **
11   |  **		Jens Hamisch, jens@Strawberry.COM			     **
12   |  ** 									     **
13   |  **   Description:	The path manipulation routines. Much of the heart of **
14   |  **			Modules is contained in this file. These routines    **
15   |  **			are responsible for adding and removing directories  **
16   |  **			from given PATH-like variables.			     **
17   |  ** 									     **
18   |  **   Exports:		cmdSetPath					     **
19   |  **			cmdRemovePath					     **
20   |  ** 									     **
21   |  **   Notes:								     **
22   |  ** 									     **
23   |  ** ************************************************************************ **
24   |  ****/
25   | 
26   | /** ** Copyright *********************************************************** **
27   |  ** 									     **
28   |  ** Copyright 1991-1994 by John L. Furlan.                      	     **
29   |  ** see LICENSE.GPL, which must be provided, for details		     **
30   |  ** 									     ** 
31   |  ** ************************************************************************ **/
32   | 
33   | static char Id[] = "@(#)$Id: cmdPath.c.src.html,v 1.9 2009/09/02 20:37:40 rkowen Exp $";
34   | static void *UseId[] = { &UseId, Id };
35   | 
36   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
37   | /** 				      HEADERS				     **/
38   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
39   | 
40   | #include "modules_def.h"
41   | #ifdef	HAS_SYS_PARAM_H
42   | #include <sys/param.h>
43   | #endif
44   | 
45   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
46   | /** 				  LOCAL DATATYPES			     **/
47   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
48   | 
49   | /** not applicable **/
50   | 
51   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
52   | /** 				     CONSTANTS				     **/
53   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
54   | 
55   | #ifdef	MAXPATHLEN
56   | #define	PATH_BUFLEN	MAXPATHLEN
57   | #else
58   | #define	PATH_BUFLEN	1024
59   | #endif
60   | 
61   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
62   | /**				      MACROS				     **/
63   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
64   | 
65   | #define _TCLCHK(a)	\
66   | 	{if (*(TCL_RESULT(a))) ErrorLogger(ERR_EXEC,LOC,TCL_RESULT(a),NULL);}
67   | 
68   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
69   | /** 				    LOCAL DATA				     **/
70   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
71   | 
72   | static	char	module_name[] = __FILE__;
73   | 
74   | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_CALLBACK
75   | static	char	_proc_cmdSetPath[] = "cmdSetPath";
76   | static	char	_proc_cmdRemovePath[] = "cmdRemovePath";
77   | static	char	_proc_Remove_Path[] = "Remove_Path";
78   | #endif
79   | 
80   | static char buffer[ PATH_BUFLEN];
81   | 
82   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
83   | /**				    PROTOTYPES				     **/
84   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
85   | 
86   | static int	Remove_Path( Tcl_Interp	*interp, char *variable, char *item, 
87   | 			char *sw_marker, const char *delim);
88   | 
89   | 
90   | /*++++
91   |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
92   |  ** 									     **
93   |  **   Function:		cmdSetPath					     **
94   |  ** 									     **
95   |  **   Description:	Add the passed value (argv[2]) to the specified vari-**
96   |  **			able (argv[1]). argv[0] specifies, if the variable   **
97   |  **			is to be appended or prepended.  Each directory in   **
98   |  **			the path is checked to see whether it is already     **
99   |  **			in the path.  If so it is not added.		     **
100  |  **			(Handles options -d C, or --delim[=]C )		     **
101  |  ** 									     **
102  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
103  |  ** 									     **
104  |  **   Parameters:	ClientData	 client_data			     **
105  |  **			Tcl_Interp	*interp		According Tcl interp.**
106  |  **			int		 argc		Number of arguments  **
107  |  **			char		*argv[]		Argument array	     **
108  |  ** 									     **
109  |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successful completion	     **
110  |  **				TCL_ERROR	Any error		     **
111  |  ** 									     **
112  |  **   Attached Globals:	g_flags		These are set up accordingly before  **
113  |  **					this function is called in order to  **
114  |  **					control everything		     **
115  |  ** 									     **
116  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
117  |  ++++*/
118  | 
119  | int	cmdSetPath(	ClientData	 client_data,
120  | 	       		Tcl_Interp	*interp,
121  | 	       		int		 argc,
122  | 	       		CONST84 char	*argv[])
123  | {
124  |     Tcl_RegExp	chkexpPtr;			/** Regular expression for   **/
125  | 						/** marker checking	     **/
126  |     char	 *oldpath,			/** Old value of 'var'	     **/
127  | 		 *newpath,			/** New value of 'var'	     **/
128  | 		 *sw_marker = APP_SW_MARKER,	/** arbitrary default	     **/
129  | 		 *startp=NULL, *endp=NULL,	/** regexp match endpts	     **/
130  | 		 *qualifiedpath,		/** List of dirs which 
131  | 						    aren't already in path   **/
132  | 		**pathlist;			/** List of dirs	     **/
133  |     const char	 *delim = _colon;		/** path delimiter	     **/
134  |     int		  append = 1,			/** append or prepend	     **/
135  | 		  numpaths,			/** number of dirs in path   **/
136  | 		  qpathlen,			/** qualifiedpath length     **/
137  | 		  arg1 = 1,			/** arg start		     **/
138  | 		  x;				/** loop index		     **/
139  | 
140  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_CALLBACK
141  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_cmdSetPath, NULL);
142  | #endif
143  | 
144  |     /**
145  |      **  Whatis mode?
146  |      **/
147  |     if( g_flags & (M_WHATIS | M_HELP))
148  |         goto success0;
149  | 	
150  |     /**
151  |      **   Check arguments. There should be at least 3 args:
152  |      **     argv[0]  -  prepend/append
153  |      **     ...
154  |      **     argv[n-1]-  varname
155  |      **     argv[n]  -  value
156  |      **/
157  |     if(argc < 3)
158  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_USAGE, LOC, argv[0],
159  | 	    " path-variable directory", NULL))
160  | 	    goto unwind0;
161  | 
162  |     /**
163  |      **  Should this guy be removed from the variable ... If yes, do so!
164  |      **/
165  |     if(g_flags & M_REMOVE) 
166  | 	return( cmdRemovePath(client_data, interp, argc, argv));   /** ----> **/
167  | 
168  |     /**
169  |      **  prepend or append. The default is append.
170  |      **/
171  |     if( !( append = !!strncmp( argv[0], "pre", 3)))
172  | 	sw_marker = PRE_SW_MARKER;
173  |   
174  |     /**
175  |      **  Non-persist mode?
176  |      **/
177  |     
178  |     if (g_flags & M_NONPERSIST) {
179  | 	return (TCL_OK);
180  |     }
181  | 
182  |     /**
183  |      **  Display only ... ok, let's do so!
184  |      **/
185  |     if(g_flags & M_DISPLAY) {
186  | 	fprintf( stderr, "%s\t ", argv[ 0]);
187  | 	while( --argc)
188  | 	    fprintf( stderr, "%s ", *++argv);
189  | 	fprintf( stderr, "\n");
190  |         goto success0;
191  |     }
192  | 
193  |     /**
194  |      **  Check for the delimiter option
195  |      **/
196  |     if(*(argv[arg1]) == '-') {
197  | 	if (!strcmp(argv[arg1], "-d")) {
198  | 		delim = argv[arg1+1];
199  | 		arg1 += 2;
200  | 	} else if (!strcmp(argv[arg1], "--delim")) {
201  | 		delim = argv[arg1+1];
202  | 		arg1 += 2;
203  | 	} else if (!strncmp(argv[arg1], "--delim=", 8)) {
204  | 		delim = argv[arg1]+8;
205  | 		arg1++;
206  | 	}
207  |     }
208  | 
209  |     /**
210  |      **  Get the old value of the variable. MANPATH defaults to "/usr/man".
211  |      **  Put a \ in front of each '.' and '+'.
212  |      **  (this is an intentional memory leak)
213  |      **/
214  |     oldpath = (char *) Tcl_GetVar2( interp, "env", argv[arg1], TCL_GLOBAL_ONLY);
215  |     _TCLCHK(interp)
216  | 
217  |     if( oldpath == NULL)
218  | 	oldpath = !strcmp( argv[arg1], "MANPATH") ? "/usr/man" : "";
219  | 
220  |     /**
221  |      **  Split the new path into its components directories so each
222  |      **  directory can be checked to see whether it is already in the 
223  |      **  existing path.
224  |      **/
225  |     if( !( pathlist = SplitIntoList( interp, (char *) argv[arg1+1], &numpaths,
226  | 	delim)))
227  | 	goto unwind0;
228  | 
229  |     /**
230  |      **  Some space for the list of paths which
231  |      **  are not already in the existing path.
232  |      **/
233  |     if((char *) NULL == (qualifiedpath = stringer(NULL,0, argv[arg1+1],
234  | 	delim, NULL)))
235  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
236  | 	    goto unwind1;
237  | 
238  |     qpathlen = strlen(qualifiedpath)+1;
239  |     *qualifiedpath = '\0';		/** make sure null for later	     **/
240  | 
241  |     for( x = 0; x < numpaths; x++) {
242  | 
243  | 	cleanse_path( pathlist[x], buffer, PATH_BUFLEN);
244  | 
245  | 	/**
246  | 	 **  Check to see if path is already in this path variable.
247  | 	 **  It could be at the 
248  | 	 **     beginning ... ^path:
249  | 	 **     middle    ... :path:
250  | 	 **     end       ... :path$
251  | 	 **     only one  ... ^path$
252  | 	 **/
253  | 	if((char *) NULL == (newpath = stringer(NULL,0,
254  | 		"(^", buffer, delim, ")|(",delim, buffer, delim,")|(",delim,
255  | 		buffer, "$)|(^", buffer, "$)",NULL)))
256  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
257  | 		goto unwind2;
258  | 
259  | 	chkexpPtr = Tcl_RegExpCompile(interp, newpath);
260  | 	_TCLCHK(interp)
261  | 	null_free((void *) &newpath);
262  | 
263  | 	/**
264  | 	 **  If the directory is not already in the path, 
265  | 	 **  add it to the qualified path.
266  | 	 **/
267  | 	if( !Tcl_RegExpExec(interp, chkexpPtr, oldpath, oldpath))
268  | 	    if ((char *) NULL ==
269  | 		    stringer(qualifiedpath + strlen(qualifiedpath),
270  | 		    qpathlen - strlen(qualifiedpath),
271  | 		    pathlist[x], delim, NULL))
272  | 		if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
273  | 		    goto unwind2;
274  | 
275  |     }					/** End of loop that checks for 
276  | 					 ** already existent path
277  | 					 **/
278  |     /**
279  |      **  If all of the directories in the new path already exist,
280  |      **  exit doing nothing.
281  |      **/
282  |     if( ! *qualifiedpath)
283  | 	goto success1;
284  | 
285  |     /* remove trailing delimiter */
286  |     qualifiedpath[strlen(qualifiedpath) - 1] = '\0';
287  | 
288  |     /**
289  |      **  Some space for our newly created path.
290  |      **  We size at the oldpath plus the addition.
291  |      **/
292  |     if((char *)NULL == (newpath = stringer(NULL, strlen( oldpath) +
293  | 	strlen(qualifiedpath) + 2,NULL)))
294  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
295  | 	    goto unwind2;
296  |     *newpath = '\0';
297  | 
298  |     /**
299  |      **  Easy job to do, if the old path has not been set up so far ...
300  |      **/
301  |     if( !strcmp( oldpath, "")) {
302  | 	strcpy( newpath, qualifiedpath);
303  | 
304  |     /**
305  |      **  Otherwise we have to take care on prepending vs. appending ...
306  |      **  If there is a append or prepend marker within the variable (see
307  |      **  modules_def.h) the changes are made according to this markers. Other-
308  |      **  wise append and prepend will be relative to the strings begin or end.
309  |      **/
310  | 
311  |     } else {
312  | 
313  | 	Tcl_RegExp	markexpPtr = Tcl_RegExpCompile(interp, sw_marker);
314  | 	_TCLCHK(interp)
315  | 
316  | 	strcpy( newpath, oldpath);
317  | 
318  | 	if( Tcl_RegExpExec(interp, markexpPtr, oldpath, oldpath)) {
319  | 	    _TCLCHK(interp)
320  | 	    Tcl_RegExpRange(markexpPtr, 0,
321  | 		(CONST84 char **) &startp, (CONST84 char **) &endp);
322  | 
323  | 	    /**
324  | 	     **  Append/Prepend marker found
325  | 	     **/
326  | 	    if( append) {
327  | 		char ch = *startp;
328  | 		*startp = '\0';
329  | 		strcpy(newpath, oldpath);
330  |                 /**
331  |                  ** check that newpath has a value before adding delim
332  |                  **/
333  | 		if (strlen(newpath) > 0 && newpath[strlen(newpath)-1] != *delim)
334  | 			strcat(newpath, delim);
335  | 		strcat(newpath, qualifiedpath);
336  | 		if (newpath[strlen(newpath)-1] != *delim)
337  | 			strcat(newpath, delim);
338  | 		*startp = ch;
339  | 		strcat(newpath, startp);
340  |                
341  | 	    } else {
342  |                 char ch = *endp;
343  | 		*endp = '\0';
344  | 		strcpy(newpath, oldpath);
345  | 		if (newpath[strlen(newpath)-1] != *delim)
346  | 			strcat(newpath, delim);
347  | 		strcat(newpath, qualifiedpath);
348  | 		*endp = ch;
349  | 		strcat(newpath, endp);
350  | 	    }
351  | 
352  | 	} else {
353  | 
354  | 	    /**
355  | 	     **  No marker set
356  | 	     **/
357  | 	    if( !append) {
358  | 		strcpy(newpath, qualifiedpath);
359  | 		if (*oldpath != *delim)	strcat(newpath, delim);
360  | 		strcat(newpath, oldpath);
361  | 	    } else {
362  | 		strcpy(newpath, oldpath);
363  | 		if (newpath[strlen(newpath)-1] != *delim)
364  | 			strcat(newpath, delim);
365  | 		strcat(newpath, qualifiedpath);
366  | 	    }
367  | 
368  | 	} /** if( marker) **/
369  | 
370  |     } /** if( strcmp) **/
371  | 
372  |     /**
373  |      **  Now the new value to be set resides in 'newpath'. Set it up.
374  |      **/
375  |     moduleSetenv( interp, (char *) argv[arg1], newpath, 1);
376  |     _TCLCHK(interp)
377  | 
378  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_CALLBACK
379  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_END, LOC, _proc_cmdSetPath, NULL);
380  | #endif
381  | 
382  |     /**
383  |      ** Free resources
384  |      **/
385  |     null_free((void *) &newpath);
386  | success1:
387  |     null_free((void *) &qualifiedpath);
388  |     FreeList( pathlist, numpaths);
389  | success0:
390  |     return( TCL_OK);			/** -------- EXIT (SUCCESS) -------> **/
391  | 
392  | unwind2:
393  |     null_free((void *) &qualifiedpath);
394  | unwind1:
395  |     FreeList( pathlist, numpaths);
396  | unwind0:
397  |     return( TCL_ERROR);			/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
398  | 
399  | } /** End of 'cmdSetPath' **/
400  | 
401  | /*++++
402  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
403  |  ** 									     **
404  |  **   Function:		cmdRemovePath					     **
405  |  ** 									     **
406  |  **   Description:	Remove the passed value (argv[2]) from the specified **
407  |  **			variable (argv[1]). In case of switching this pro-   **
408  |  **			cedure removes markers from the path, too. argv[0]   **
409  |  **			specifies, if the append- or prepend-marker is af-   **
410  |  **			fected						     **
411  |  ** 									     **
412  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
413  |  ** 									     **
414  |  **   Parameters:	ClientData	 client_data			     **
415  |  **			Tcl_Interp	*interp		According Tcl interp.**
416  |  **			int		 argc		Number of arguments  **
417  |  **			char		*argv[]		Argument array	     **
418  |  ** 									     **
419  |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successful completion	     **
420  |  **				TCL_ERROR	Any error		     **
421  |  ** 									     **
422  |  **   Attached Globals:	g_flags		These are set up accordingly before  **
423  |  **					this function is called in order to  **
424  |  **					control everything		     **
425  |  ** 									     **
426  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
427  |  ++++*/
428  | 
429  | int	cmdRemovePath(	ClientData	 client_data,
430  | 	       		Tcl_Interp	*interp,
431  | 	       		int		 argc,
432  | 	       		CONST84 char	*argv[])
433  | {
434  |     char	 *sw_marker = APP_SW_MARKER,	/** arbitrary default	     **/
435  | 		**pathlist;			/** List of dirs	     **/
436  |     const char	 *delim = _colon;		/** path delimiter	     **/
437  |     int		  numpaths,			/** number of dirs in path   **/
438  | 		  arg1 = 1,			/** arg start		     **/
439  | 		  x;				/** loop index		     **/
440  | 
441  | 
442  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_CALLBACK
443  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_cmdRemovePath, NULL);
444  | #endif
445  | 
446  |     /**
447  |      **   Check arguments. There should be give 3 args:
448  |      **     argv[0]  -  prepend/append/remove-path
449  |      **     ...
450  |      **     argv[n-1]-  varname
451  |      **     argv[n]  -  value
452  |      **/
453  |     if(argc < 3)
454  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_USAGE,LOC,argv[0],"path-variable directory",
455  | 	    NULL))
456  | 	    goto unwind0;
457  | 
458  |   
459  |     /**
460  |      **  Non-persist mode?
461  |      **/
462  |     
463  |     if (g_flags & M_NONPERSIST) {
464  | 	return (TCL_OK);
465  |     }
466  | 
467  |     /**
468  |      **  Display only ... ok, let's do so!
469  |      **/
470  |     if(g_flags & M_DISPLAY) {
471  | 	fprintf( stderr, "%s\t ", argv[ 0]);
472  | 	while( --argc)
473  | 	    fprintf( stderr, "%s ", *++argv);
474  | 	fprintf( stderr, "\n");
475  |         goto success0;
476  |     }
477  |   
478  |     /**
479  |      **  prepend or append. The default is append.
480  |      **/
481  |     if( ! strncmp( argv[0], "pre", 3))
482  | 	sw_marker = PRE_SW_MARKER;
483  |   
484  |     /**
485  |      ** For switch state3, we're looking to remove the markers.
486  |      **/
487  |     if( g_flags & M_SWSTATE3) 
488  | 	argv[arg1+1] = sw_marker;
489  | 
490  |     /**
491  |      **  Check for the delimiter option
492  |      **/
493  |     if(*(argv[arg1]) == '-') {
494  | 	if (!strcmp(argv[arg1], "-d")) {
495  | 		delim = argv[arg1+1];
496  | 		arg1 += 2;
497  | 	} else if (!strcmp(argv[arg1], "--delim")) {
498  | 		delim = argv[arg1+1];
499  | 		arg1 += 2;
500  | 	} else if (!strncmp(argv[arg1], "--delim=", 8)) {
501  | 		delim = argv[arg1]+8;
502  | 		arg1++;
503  | 	}
504  |     }
505  | 
506  |     /**
507  |      **  Split the path into its components so each item can be removed
508  |      **  individually from the variable.
509  |      **/
510  |     if( !( pathlist = SplitIntoList( interp, (char *) argv[arg1+1], &numpaths,
511  | 	delim)))
512  | 	goto unwind0;
513  | 
514  |     /**
515  |      ** Remove each item individually
516  |      **/
517  |     for( x = 0; x < numpaths; x++)
518  | 	if(TCL_OK != Remove_Path(interp,(char *) argv[arg1],pathlist[x],
519  | 	sw_marker, delim))
520  | 	    goto unwind1;
521  | 
522  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_CALLBACK
523  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_END, LOC, _proc_cmdRemovePath, NULL);
524  | #endif
525  | 
526  |     /**
527  |      ** Free resources
528  |      **/
529  |     FreeList(pathlist, numpaths);
530  | 
531  | success0:
532  |     return( TCL_OK);			/** -------- EXIT (SUCCESS) -------> **/
533  | 
534  | unwind1:
535  |     FreeList(pathlist, numpaths);
536  | unwind0:
537  |     return( TCL_ERROR);			/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
538  | 
539  | } /** End of 'cmdRemovePath' **/
540  | 
541  | /*++++
542  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
543  |  ** 									     **
544  |  **   Function:		Remove_Path					     **
545  |  ** 									     **
546  |  **   Description:	This function actually does the work of removing     **
547  |  **			the item from the path.  It is done this way to      **
548  |  **			support multiple items (often directories)	     **
549  |  **			separated by colons in the variable value.	     **
550  |  ** 									     **
551  |  **   First Edition:	2001/08/08					     **
552  |  ** 									     **
553  |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		According Tcl interp.**
554  |  **			char		*variable	Variable from which  **
555  |  **							to remove item	     **
556  |  **			char		*item		Item to remove	     **
557  |  **			char		*sw_marker	Switch marker	     **
558  |  **			const char	*delim		path delimiter	     **
559  |  ** 									     **
560  |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successful completion	     **
561  |  **				TCL_ERROR	Any error		     **
562  |  ** 									     **
563  |  **   Attached Globals:	g_flags		These are set up accordingly before  **
564  |  **					this function is called in order to  **
565  |  **					control everything		     **
566  |  ** 									     **
567  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
568  |  ++++*/
569  | 
570  | static int	Remove_Path(	Tcl_Interp	*interp,
571  | 	       			char		*variable,
572  | 	       			char		*item,
573  | 				char		*sw_marker,
574  | 				const char	*delim)
575  | {
576  |     char	*oldpath,			/** Old value of 'var'	     **/
577  |     		*tmppath,			/** Temp. buffer for 'var'   **/
578  |     		*searchpath,
579  | 		*startp=NULL, *endp=NULL;	/** regexp match endpts	     **/
580  |     int  	 start_offset = 0,		/** match offsets	     **/
581  |     		 end_offset = 0,
582  | 		 path_len = 0;			/** length of unmatched path **/
583  |     Tcl_RegExp	regexpPtr  = (Tcl_RegExp) NULL,
584  |     		begexpPtr  = (Tcl_RegExp) NULL,
585  |     		midexpPtr  = (Tcl_RegExp) NULL,
586  |     		endexpPtr  = (Tcl_RegExp) NULL,
587  |     		onlyexpPtr = (Tcl_RegExp) NULL,
588  |     		markexpPtr = (Tcl_RegExp) NULL;
589  | 
590  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_CALLBACK
591  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_Remove_Path, NULL);
592  | #endif
593  | 
594  |     /**
595  |      **  Get the current value of the "PATH" environment variable
596  |      **/
597  |     if( NULL == (tmppath = (char *) Tcl_GetVar2( interp, "env", variable,
598  | 	TCL_GLOBAL_ONLY))) {
599  | 	_TCLCHK(interp)
600  | 	return( TCL_OK);		/** -------- EXIT (SUCCESS) -------> **/
601  |     }    
602  | 
603  |     /**
604  |      **  We want to make a local copy of old path because we're going
605  |      **  to be butchering it and the environ one doesn't need to be
606  |      **  changed in this manner.
607  |      **  Put a \ in front of each . and + in the passed value to remove.
608  |      **/
609  |     if((char *) NULL == (oldpath = stringer(NULL,0, tmppath, NULL)))
610  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
611  | 	    goto unwind0;
612  |     path_len = strlen(oldpath);
613  |     cleanse_path( item, buffer, PATH_BUFLEN);
614  | 
615  |     /**
616  |      **  Now we need to find it in the path variable.  So, we create
617  |      **  space enough to build search expressions.
618  |      **/
619  |     if((char *) NULL == (searchpath = stringer(NULL,0,"^", buffer,
620  | 	delim, NULL)))
621  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
622  | 	    goto unwind1;
623  | 
624  |     /**
625  |      **  This section searches for the oldpath in the PATH variable.
626  |      **  There are four cases because the colons must be used as markers
627  |      **  in order to guarantee that a partial match isn't being found.
628  |      ** 
629  |      **  The start_offset and end_offset variables indicate how much to 
630  |      **  cut or not to cut off of each end of the located
631  |      **  string.  They differ for each case...beginning of
632  |      **  the path, middle of the path, end of the path, 
633  |      **  and for the only path.
634  |      ** 
635  |      **  This is to ensure the colons get cut off properly.
636  |      **/
637  | 
638  |     begexpPtr = Tcl_RegExpCompile(interp,  searchpath);
639  |     _TCLCHK(interp)
640  | 
641  |     if( Tcl_RegExpExec(interp, begexpPtr, oldpath, oldpath) > 0) {
642  | 	_TCLCHK(interp)
643  | 	regexpPtr = begexpPtr;
644  | 
645  | 	/**
646  | 	 **  Copy from the beginning of the startp to one
647  | 	 **  character before endp
648  | 	 **/
649  | 
650  | 	Tcl_RegExpRange(begexpPtr, 0,
651  | 		(CONST84 char **) &startp, (CONST84 char **) &endp);
652  | 	start_offset = 0; end_offset = -1;
653  | 	path_len -= (endp - startp - 1);
654  | 
655  |     } else {
656  | 
657  | 	*searchpath = *delim;	/* :buffer: */
658  | 	midexpPtr = Tcl_RegExpCompile(interp, searchpath);
659  | 	_TCLCHK(interp)
660  | 
661  | 	if( Tcl_RegExpExec(interp, midexpPtr, oldpath, oldpath) > 0) {
662  | 	    _TCLCHK(interp)
663  | 	    regexpPtr = midexpPtr;
664  | 
665  | 	    /**
666  | 	     **  Copy from one character after stringp[0] to one
667  | 	     **  character before endp[0]
668  | 	     **/
669  | 
670  | 	    Tcl_RegExpRange(midexpPtr, 0,
671  | 		(CONST84 char **) &startp, (CONST84 char **) &endp);
672  | 	    start_offset = 1; end_offset = -1;
673  | 	    path_len -= (endp - startp - 2);
674  | 
675  | 	} else {
676  | 
677  | 	    searchpath[strlen(searchpath)-1] = '$';	/* :buffer$ */
678  | 	    endexpPtr = Tcl_RegExpCompile(interp, searchpath);
679  | 	    _TCLCHK(interp)
680  | 
681  | 	    if( Tcl_RegExpExec(interp, endexpPtr, oldpath, oldpath) > 0) {
682  | 		_TCLCHK(interp)
683  | 		regexpPtr = endexpPtr;
684  | 
685  | 		/**
686  | 		 **  Copy from one character after stringp[0] 
687  | 		 **  through endp[0]
688  | 		 **/
689  | 
690  | 		Tcl_RegExpRange(endexpPtr, 0,
691  | 			(CONST84 char **) &startp, (CONST84 char **) &endp);
692  | 		start_offset = 0; end_offset = 0;
693  | 		path_len -= (endp - startp - 1);
694  | 
695  | 	    } else {
696  | 
697  | 		*searchpath = '^';	/* ^buffer$ */
698  | 		onlyexpPtr = Tcl_RegExpCompile(interp, searchpath);
699  | 		_TCLCHK(interp)
700  | 
701  | 		if(Tcl_RegExpExec(interp, onlyexpPtr, oldpath, oldpath) > 0) {
702  | 		    _TCLCHK(interp)
703  | 
704  | 		    /**
705  | 		     **  In this case, I should go ahead and unset the variable
706  | 		     **  from the environment because I'm removing the very last
707  | 		     **  path.
708  | 		     **
709  | 		     **  First I'm going to clear the variable from the
710  | 		     **  setenvHashTable just in case its already been altered
711  | 		     **  and had a significant value at the time. It's very
712  | 		     **  possible that I'm removing the only two or three paths
713  | 		     **  from this variable. If that's the case, then all the
714  | 		     **  earlier paths were marked for output in this hashTable.
715  | 		     **
716  | 		     **  Secondly, I actually mark the the environment variable
717  | 		     **  to be unset when output.
718  | 		     **/
719  | 		    clear_hash_value( setenvHashTable, variable);
720  | 		    moduleUnsetenv( interp, variable);
721  | 
722  | 		    /**
723  | 		     **  moduleUnsetenv doesn't unset the variable in the Tcl
724  | 		     **  space because the $env variable might need to be
725  | 		     **  used again in the modulefile for locating other
726  | 		     **  paths.  BUT, since this was a path-type environment
727  | 		     **  variable, the user is expecting this to be empty
728  | 		     **  after removing the only remaining path.  So, I set
729  | 		     **  the variable empty here.
730  | 		     **/
731  | 		    (void) Tcl_SetVar2( interp, "env", variable, "",
732  | 			TCL_GLOBAL_ONLY);
733  | 		    _TCLCHK(interp)
734  | 		    null_free((void *) &searchpath);
735  | 		    goto success1;
736  | 		}
737  | 	    }
738  | 	}
739  |     }
740  |     null_free((void *) &searchpath);
741  | 
742  |     /**
743  |      **  If I couldn't find it assume it wasn't there
744  |      **  and return.
745  |      **/
746  |     if( !regexpPtr)
747  | 	goto success1;
748  | 
749  |     markexpPtr = Tcl_RegExpCompile(interp, sw_marker);
750  |     _TCLCHK(interp)
751  | 
752  |     /**
753  |      **  In state1, we're actually replacing old paths with
754  |      **  the markers for future appends and prepends.
755  |      **  
756  |      **  We only want to do this once to mark the location
757  |      **  the module was formed around.
758  |      **/
759  |     if((g_flags & M_SWSTATE1) && ! (Tcl_RegExpExec(interp,
760  | 	 markexpPtr, oldpath, oldpath) > 0)) {
761  | 
762  | 	/**
763  | 	 **  If I don't have enough space to replace the oldpath with the
764  | 	 **  marker, then I must create space for the marker and thus
765  | 	 **  recreate the PATH variable.
766  | 	 **/
767  | 	char* newenv;
768  | 	int newlen = path_len + strlen(sw_marker) + 1;
769  |       
770  | 	if((char *) NULL==(newenv = stringer(NULL, newlen ,NULL) ))
771  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
772  | 		goto unwind1;
773  | 
774  | 	*(startp + start_offset) = '\0';
775  | 
776  | 	if(*(endp + end_offset) == '\0') {
777  | 	    (void) stringer(newenv, newlen, oldpath,delim,sw_marker,NULL);
778  | 	} else {
779  | 	    (void) stringer(newenv, newlen, oldpath,sw_marker,
780  | 		endp + end_offset, NULL);
781  | 	}
782  | 
783  | 	/**
784  | 	 **  Just store the value with the marker into the environment.  I'm not
785  | 	 **  checking if it changed because the only case that a PATH-type
786  | 	 **  variable will be unset is when I remove the only path remaining in
787  | 	 **  the variable.  So, using moduleSetenv is not necessary here.
788  | 	 **/
789  | 	Tcl_SetVar2( interp, "env", variable, newenv, TCL_GLOBAL_ONLY);
790  | 	_TCLCHK(interp)
791  | 	null_free((void *) &newenv);
792  | 
793  |     } else {  /** SW_STATE1 **/
794  | 
795  | 	/**
796  | 	 **  We must be in SW_STATE3 or not in SW_STATE at all.
797  | 	 **  Removing the marker should be just like removing any other path.
798  | 	 **/
799  | 	strcpy( startp + start_offset, endp);
800  | 
801  | 	/**
802  | 	 **  Cache the set.  Clear the variable from the unset table just
803  | 	 **  in case it was previously unset.
804  | 	 **/
805  | 	store_hash_value( setenvHashTable, variable, oldpath);
806  | 	clear_hash_value( unsetenvHashTable, variable);
807  | 
808  | 	/**
809  | 	 **  Store the new PATH value into the environment.
810  | 	 **/
811  | 	Tcl_SetVar2( interp, "env", variable, oldpath, TCL_GLOBAL_ONLY);
812  | 	_TCLCHK(interp)
813  | 
814  |     }  /** ! SW_STATE1 **/
815  | 
816  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_CALLBACK
817  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_END, LOC, _proc_cmdRemovePath, NULL);
818  | #endif
819  | 
820  |     /**
821  |      **  Free what has been used and return on success
822  |      **/
823  | success1:
824  |     null_free((void *) &oldpath);
825  | success0:
826  |     return( TCL_OK);		/** -------- EXIT (SUCCESS) -------> **/
827  | 
828  | unwind1:
829  |     null_free((void *) &oldpath);
830  | unwind0:
831  |     return( TCL_ERROR);		/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
832  | 
833  | } /** End of 'Remove_Path' **/
